jobs.description:
As a Senior Project Manager/ Senior Delivery Manager for Global Customers, you will be a critical leader in our Vietnam delivery organization.
You will be responsible for commercial success and end-to-end delivery of large, complex IT programs focused on Microsoft technologies and Enterprise application development for our international clientele.
This role requires a dynamic individual with a proven track record of successful program execution, strong customer engagement skills, and the ability to drive both project success and strategic growth through delivery excellence.
You will lead cross-functional teams, manage stakeholders across multiple geographies, and ensure the successful achievement of program objectives while contributing to the overall growth and reputation of our company.
Your Main Responsibilities
• Strategic Planning: Define program scope, objectives, deliverables, and success criteria in collaboration with global clients and internal stakeholders. Develop comprehensive program plans, roadmaps, and resource allocation strategies.
• Execution Leadership: Lead and oversee the execution of all program phases, from initiation and planning to execution, monitoring, and closure, ensuring adherence to methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid).
• Risk & Issue Management: Proactively identify, assess, and mitigate program risks and issues. Develop contingency plans and escalation strategies to minimize impact on schedule, budget, and quality.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure the delivery of high-quality solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations and industry standards. Implement and enforce quality assurance processes throughout the program lifecycle.
• Budget & Schedule Management: Manage program budgets, forecasts, and schedules effectively, ensuring projects are delivered within agreed-upon financial and timeline constraints. Report on financial performance and project progress regularly.
• Technology Leadership: Possess a strong understanding of Microsoft technologies (Azure, .NET, Dynamics 365, Power Platform, SharePoint, etc.) and application development best practices. Guide technical teams and ensure alignment with architectural principles.
• Customer Satisfaction: Build and maintain strong, trusted relationships with global customers. Proactively identify customer needs and pain points, acting as a strategic advisor.
• Opportunity Identification: Continuously look for opportunities to expand existing engagements and identify new business potential by demonstrating value, showcasing capabilities, and understanding customer roadmaps.
• Proactive Solutions: Propose innovative solutions and value-added services that align with customer goals and company capabilities.
• Thought Leadership: Contribute to white papers, case studies, and presentations to showcase delivery successes and industry expertise.
• Customer Relationship: Serve as the primary point of contact for global clients, managing expectations, communicating progress, and resolving escalations effectively.
jobs.requirements:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree or MBA is a plus.
Experience
• Minimum of 10+ years of progressive experience in IT project/program management, with at least 5 years in Program Manager role.
• Extensive professional leadership experience in the IT or Software industry, with a strong focus on both technology and business. Proven track record of:
  • Leading and developing teams in an agile environment.
  • Driving change management initiatives.
  • Creating business value through understanding customer needs and implementing relevant IT solutions.
  • Managing customer relations and projects within an Enterprise IT Products and Services environment.
  • Developing and implementing mid- to long-term strategic visions.
  • Engaging in senior executive-level stakeholder management.
Skills
• Strong customer focus.
• Excellent communication and conflict resolution skills.
• Passion for technology and networking.
• Proven ability to lead and motivate in a non-hierarchical manner.
• Results-oriented mindset with a focus on maximizing business value.
• Effective prioritization skills in resource-constrained environments.
• Strong understanding of SDLC methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid).
• Familiarity with DevOps principles and tools.
• Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps, MS Project).
• Solid understanding of architectural principles and software design patterns.
Languages: Business fluent in written and spoken English. German is a plus.
Certifications: PMP, PRINCE2, Agile certifications (CSM, SAFe) are highly desirable.

jobs.location: Tầng 2, Tòa nhà REE Tower, Số 9 Đoạn Văn Bò, Phường 12, Quận 4, Tp.HCM
jobs.description:
OBJECTIVES
We are seeking a detail-oriented 
Senior IT Budget and Vendor Management Specialist 
with strong contractual knowledge to oversee all post-contracting and renewal activities with IT vendors; and to support the efficient management of IT budget. This role will be primarily responsible for driving IT vendor governance, performance, compliance, and contract negotiations, while also contributing to the planning, tracking, and reporting of IT budgets and costs. The ideal candidate will bring deep expertise in Vendor Lifecycle Management especially in Technical or Financial Services Field, combined with strong analytical and budget management capability.
JOB DESCRIPTION
IT Vendor Management (60%)
•	Vendor Lifecycle Oversight: Support vendor onboarding & offboarding process, as well as the ongoing governance of IT vendors across infrastructure, software, and managed services.
•	Contract Management & Negotiation: Monitor contract renewal schedules and vendor payments; support negotiating new and renewal contracts with vendors to secure optimal terms, pricing, KPIs and service-level agreements (SLAs) while minimizing risk.
•	Performance Monitoring: Track vendor performance against defined SLAs & KPIs. Manage service issues, escalate when necessary, and coordinate periodic service and performance reviews.
•	Vendor Relationship Management: Act as the primary liaison between internal IT/business stakeholders and external vendors, ensuring alignment with strategic goals and expectations.
•	Risk & Compliance: Collaborate with relevant teams to ensure vendor engagements comply with internal policies and regulatory requirements.
•	Governance Reporting: Develop & maintain vendor scorecards, risk registers, and documentation to support internal governance and IT vendor risk oversight.
IT Budget Control & Financial Support (30%)
•	Budget Planning: Support annual IT budget planning activities based on the IT portfolio, strategic initiatives, and business priorities.
•	Budget Monitoring: Support tracking IT operating and capital expenditures to ensure alignment with approved budgets and contractual commitments.
•	Proposal submission: Coordinate with internal IT stakeholders to prepare IT purchase proposals and manage end-to-end proposal submission in compliance with company procedures.
•	Acceptance Note Review: Review vendor deliverables and acceptance notes for alignment with contract terms and service performance.
•	Financial Reporting: Collaborate with Finance to develop & maintain monthly budget variance analysis, accrual tracking, and reporting for IT leadership.
•	Cost Optimization: Identify cost-saving opportunities through contract consolidation, license optimization, or service adjustments. Coordinate with Procurement to execute the saving initiative. 
Other (10%)
•	Procurement related task: Monitor and follow on TAT of IT procurement/payment requests.
•	Ad-hoc tasks assigned by Line Manager.
jobs.requirements:
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES
•	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Finance, Business, or a related field.
•	Minimum of 3 experience working in vendor management, sourcing, or procurement, preferably in banking, financial institution or insurance
•	Familiarity with IT/ Vendor risk management is a plus
•	Experience in cost optimization initiatives is a plus
•	Strong negotiation and commercial analysis skills
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Vietnamese
•	Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to manage relationships across internal stakeholders and external vendors
•	Highly detail-oriented with an analytical mindset and a focus on process improvement
jobs.benefits:
- 2-4 months salary bonus
- Premium Healthcare Insurance

We are looking for a highly skilled and proactive Senior Data Engineer to lead the design and development of our data foundation. This role is critical in building robust data pipelines, managing databases, enabling scalable data structure, and ensuring high data quality and observability at companywide. You’ll work with stakeholders across engineering, analytics, and operations to unlock the full value of data across the organization.
Key Responsibilities
•	Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines (batch and streaming) using tools such as Kafka, AWS Glue, DBT, or Airflow.
•	Build and manage data warehouse / data mart for BI, reporting, and advanced analytics.
•	Collaborate with software teams to ensure integration seamlessly with data systems.
•	Implement data quality frameworks (validation, deduplication, lineage tracking).
•	Support CDP integration.
•	Monitor and administer production databases (Oracle, PostgreSQL, MySQL). Acting as the first line of defense for any database-related issues, diagnosing the root cause of problems, and implementing effective solutions to minimize downtime.
•	Ensure high availability (HA), backup/restore, replication, and disaster recovery strategies are in place.
•	Automate DB operational tasks.
•	Enforce data security, access control, and compliance with PCI DSS, GDPR, and local regulations (Decree 13, SBV).
•	Implementing robust processes to retrieve data from many sources of databases. This involves managing different data formats, protocols, and extraction methods (batch, streaming).
•	Researching and evaluating new database management systems (e.g., NoSQL, NewSQL, Graph databases), data warehouse or cloud-native services to see if they would better serve upcoming business needs.
•	Capacity Planning: monitoring the growth of the database to forecast future storage and processing needs, ensuring the system can scale with increasing data volume and user load.
•	Cost Forecasting: analyzing usage to predict future database-related costs.
•	License Management: planning for the renewal and management of expensive commercial database licenses.

•	5+ years of experience in data engineering or similar.

•	Experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow).
•	Expertise in at least one programming language commonly used in data engineering (e.g., Python, Scala, Java).
•	Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and services like S3, Glue, Redshift, BigQuery, or ClickHouse.
•	Strong understanding of data warehousing, data lakes, and pipeline orchestration.
Preferred
•	Prior experience in fintech, e-commerce, or high-scale environments.

Crossian is a high-growth, technology-driven e-commerce business. Behind our success is our people. Since launching in 2020, we've built a dynamic, fast-paced environment enabling both our business and team members to achieve a cumulative average growth rate of over 1000% in just three years. Our mission now is to build powerful direct-to-consumer brands and maximize customer lifetime value.
We’re currently looking for a UI Designer (with UX mindset) who is passionate about visual design, but also understands how users think and what makes digital interfaces truly usable.
As a UI Designer, you’ll work on real product features across our eCommerce platform - from product management to payment, analytics, and beyond. You’ll design clean, scalable UI that supports real user goals. You’ll also collaborate closely with Developers, PMs, and Data Analysts, using live user data to inform and improve your designs.

Simplify complex flows
 • Own UI design for some of the most complex workflows in our eCommerce platform - like product setup, inventory rules, fulfillment settings, and analytics dashboards

UI & Design Systems

 • Apply layout grids, spacing logic, typography, and visual hierarchy
 • Build reusable components and contribute to our shared Design System
Design with data
 • Use real user data — behavior tracking, funnels, and test results — to make design decisions and measure outcomes.
 • Work closely with PMs, Developers, and Analysts across the product lifecycle: discovery, delivery, iteration.
 • Join agile rituals and present your work clearly in design reviews and product discussions.

jobs.title: Pricing and Data Analyst
jobs.location: Hà Nội, Vietnam
jobs.description:
Position Overview
 
Seoul Semiconductor is seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Pricing and Data Analyst to join our Pricing Team.
This role will be responsible for supporting the development and execution of pricing strategies, analyzing market and sales data, conducting simulations, and providing actionable insights to optimize revenue and profit across our global LED product lines.
Key Responsibilities
- Analyze historical sales, pricing, and market data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks.
- Develop and maintain pricing models, elasticity studies, and competitive price benchmarking.
- Support optimal price setting by business group and key products, considering volume, competition, and profitability targets.
- Conduct simulations to forecast revenue, profit impact, and volume scenarios under different pricing strategies.
- Collaborate with Sales, Product Management, and Finance teams to align pricing strategies with business goals.
- Monitor price realization performance and support corrective actions when deviations occur.
- Support quarterly and annual pricing reviews, management reports, and executive decision-making presentations.
- Ensure data integrity across pricing tools and systems and continuously improve data processes.
- Contribute to automation initiatives to streamline pricing and analysis processes.
jobs.requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
- 2+ years of experience in Pricing, Data Analysis, Business Analysis, or similar roles (experience in a semiconductor or electronics company is a plus).
- Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
- Experience with statistical analysis tools or platforms (e.g., Minitab, R, Python) is a plus.
- Familiarity with pricing optimization concepts (e.g., price elasticity, contribution margin analysis).
- Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
- Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced global environment.
- Strong attention to detail and problem-solving mindset.
Preferred Skills
- Experience in global B2B pricing strategy.
- Knowledge of LED, semiconductor, or electronics markets.
- Understanding of Incoterms, tariffs, and international trade pricing considerations.
Why Join Us
- Be part of a leading global innovator in LED technology.
- Work in a dynamic and growing international environment.
- Opportunity to influence business strategies with data-driven insights.
- Career growth opportunities in pricing, data science, and business analytics.
What we can offer	
- Work 5 days/week (Monday - Friday)
- Shuttle bus from Ha Noi to Ha Nam on a daily basis
- Enjoy Statutory Holidays and Annual Leaves
- Enjoy Social, Health, Unemployment insurance from probation
- 13th month bonus, Team Dinner, Happy Weekend,…
- Korea Oversea training courses
- Yearly salary review
- An open Global working environment & opportunities for promotion, career development.
